item.title: Monster Hunter Stories: How to Use Egg Fragments
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Are Egg Fragments In Monster Hunter Stories?
  • How To Use Egg Fragments In MHST

Players who are used to playing Monster Hunter games know that the Monster Hunters in the game hunt the monsters. However, in Monster Hunter Stories, players are able to take on the role of a Monster Rider, someone who lives alongside monsters. With the remake, players are able to hop back into this amazing world.

As someone who works with monsters, players will be able to find Monster Eggs and raise their Monsties. They can also find Egg Fragments in the game, which will allow them to create Monster Eggs. After finding enough Monster Eggs, they will be able to add even more Monsties to their team. Here's a guide to using Egg Fragments.

What Are Egg Fragments In Monster Hunter Stories?

Egg Fragments are small fragments of Monster Eggs that can be put together to create Monster Eggs. Fragments can be used to slowly build up Monster Eggs at any time in the game, and then they can be hatched after they are put together.

These fragments can be found all around the world as items on the ground. This means that players will want to check out the items scattered around anytime they run into them. If they find Egg Fragments, they will be able to create Monster Eggs and hatch new Monsties for their team. They can also be obtained from Network Battles, which are battles players can participate in via the network if they want to.

How To Use Egg Fragments In MHST

Egg Fragments aren't too difficult to use, but it can be challenging to build the egg and hatch it. In order to use them, players will need to find them and then go to one of the stables around the game. Here, they will be able to select their Egg Carton. From there, selecting the "Egg Fragment" option will pull up all the Egg Fragments the player has found throughout their game.

After navigating to this menu, players will need to find Egg Fragments that seem to match each other. This will allow them to slowly build a new egg that can be hatched. Once the egg is built, players will just need to select it in the "Hatch Egg" section. Depending on what the egg looks like, players may obtain a whole host of Monsties to add to their team this way.

item.title: Pokemon Fan Shares LEGO Magnemite
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon fans can create their own Magnemite LEGO build with just 54 pieces, thanks to detailed instructions shared online.
  • Although there are no official Pokemon LEGO collaborations, fans can still enjoy creating custom Pokemon creations with LEGOs.
  • Resources like detailed schematics shared by fans allow avid LEGO enthusiasts to bring their favorite Pokemon characters to life.

A Pokemon fan has shared an impressive LEGO build of Magnemite. The fan showed off multiple images of the Magnemite and also provided detailed instructions on how fellow Pokemon fanatics can create their own.

Pokemon fans and LEGO often go together, even though there are no official collaborations between the two brands. Pokemon has received Mega Bloks kits in the past, and other Nintendo properties like Zelda and Animal Crossing have gotten LEGO releases. However, part of the charm and appeal of LEGOs has always been the ability to build whatever a user puts their mind to, and that includes plenty of Pokemon. Magnemite's appearance and colors make it a good choice for a custom LEGO creation like this one.

Now, Pokemon fan eyemcantoeknees has shared their rendition of Magnemite in LEGOs. The build is extremely accurate to Magnemite's appearance, with the fan sharing images of it from multiple angles. The build would be impressive enough on its own, but eyemcantoeknees was also kind enough to share a schematic on how fellow fans can put together their own Magnemite LEGO creation. Pokemon fans will need a total of 54 individual LEGO pieces in order to create their own Magnemite. It's not too demanding, and the build doesn't look extremely difficult, especially with detailed instructions to follow.

Pokemon Fans' Call for LEGO Sets Goes Unanswered

Pokemon fans never stop finding unique ways to celebrate the legendary pocket monsters, and that includes in blocky form with LEGOs. May fans have shared Pokemon LEGO builds in the past, in varying levels of difficulty and size. However, not all fans have shared how they put their creations together like eyemcantoekneeshas. This is unfortunate, since some LEGO owners might want to put together their own versions of the creations.

This wouldn't be as big a problem if Pokemon released its own official LEGO collections. LEGO has collaborated with tons of different companies, game developers, and media properties to either make LEGO games or sets. Considering that Mega Bloks is considered to be a LEGO competitor, it seems unlikely that Pokemon fans will get their wish for themed LEGO sets so long as Pokemon is partnered with Mattel to make Mega Bloks.

Thankfully, there are many resources available for avid LEGO fans that provide detailed schematics like eyemcantoeknees'. While some fans hold out for an official Pokemon LEGO collaboration, players can at least use the blocks that exist to make their own creations.

item.title: Elden Ring: 6 Smallest Bosses In The Game
item.description:
Highlights

  • Elden Ring's DLC introduces new boss battles in Shadow of the Erdtree, showcasing a variety of enemies in different sizes and shapes.
  • NPCs in the game play minor roles unless they are part of boss battles, adding depth to exploration and encounters in the Lands Between.
  • From massive creatures like Divine Beast Dancing Lion to smaller bosses like Soldier of Godrick, Elden Ring offers a diverse range of challenges.

With the release of Elden Ring 's latest DLC, Shadow of the Erdtree , many players have found themselves fighting new bosses and facing others that they've defeated in the past. The Lands Between is filled with all sorts of enemies that come in a variety of different shapes and sizes, and while many of them aren't gigantic, they can still be pretty dangerous.

While exploring the world of Elden Ring and encountering its various boss fights, it's only natural that some players may begin to wonder how big the enemies can actually get. While pondering this thought, gamers may also begin to wonder what the smallest bosses in the game are, and there are quite a few to be encountered.

6 Divine Beast Dancing Lion

Height: 12-13 Feet

Location

Belurat, the Tower Settlement

Drops

120,000 Runes, Remembrance of the Dancing Lion, Divine Beast Head

HP

25,972

This new boss, introduced in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, is no joke. Similar to the Lion Guardians spread all over the Lands Between, this powerful creature with humanoid facial features is challenging and lightning-fast. Players who've already defeated the Divine Beast Dancing Lion can attest to this boss' high difficulty and swift moveset.

That said, while this boss is formidable, its size isn't. At least not when compared to other massive bosses in the game, such as the Fire Giant or Elder Dragon Greyoll . Standing at approximately 13 feet tall, this dancing lion will make more than one Tarnished feel frustrated and powerless.

5 Radagon Of The Golden Order

Height: 10 Feet

Location

Stone Platform (Inside the Erdtree)

Drops

N/A (500,000 Runes after defeating the Elden Beast)

HP

13,339

Consort to Queen Marika and father to Malenia and many other demi-gods in Elden Ring , Radagon of the Golden Order is a force to be reckoned with. As the first obstacle within the Erdtree, he swings a powerful golden hammer that inflicts strong physical damage and can deliver wide AoE attacks. While he's not the toughest boss in the last stages of the game, players should still approach him with respect and caution.

He doesn't drop any Runes when defeated, but he gives way to the Elden Beast boss fight, which does yield a considerable number of them. Radagon, once the proud spouse of Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon , now stands a broken god who will defend the Elden Throne at all costs. At approximately 10 feet tall, he easily towers over the Tarnished yet remains one of the smallest bosses in the game.

4 Malenia

Height: 8 Feet

Location

Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree

Drops

480,000 Runes, Malenia's Great Rune, Remembrance of the Rot Goddess

HP

33,251

It's almost impossible to find an Elden Ring player who doesn't know about Malenia, Blade of Miquella . Even if some have never faced her themselves, her reputation as arguably the hardest boss in the game precedes her. Daughter of Radagon of the Golden Order and Queen Marika, she is one of the quickest-moving bosses in the game and has a frustrating healing ability that restores her Health whenever she manages to hit the Tarnished.

Although she was once a mighty, healthy demi-god, strong enough to defeat Starscourge Radahn , she's now covered with Scarlett Rot and lives her days deep within the Haligtree. Among many things, Malenia is responsible for having unleashed the Scarlet Rot upon Caelid, leaving the area in the putrid state that players find it in. She's one of the bosses who drop the largest number of Runes upon defeat and has a stature of approximately 8 feet.

3 Stormhill Evergaol Crucible Knight

Height: 7.8 Feet

Location

Stormhill Evergaol

Drops

2,100 Runes, Aspects of the Crucible: Tail

HP

2,868

Crucible Knight enemies are widely spread across the Lands Between in Elden RIng . Typically, they can be found by entering Evergaols; however, they also inhabit other areas of the game, and sometimes, they can be accompanied by other knights, which makes defeating them a nearly impossible task. There's a total of 16 Crucible Knights in Elden Ring , and each is more challenging than the last.

Players who wish to face them must learn their attack patterns to perfection, as they not only use their swords and shields to fight but also have access to a wide set of magical abilities that players will be rewarded with if they manage to defeat them. Standing at a "meager" 7.8 feet tall, Crucible Knights are one of the smallest boss types in Elden Ring ; however, they pack a huge punch and have one of the most aggressive movesets in the game, leaving close to no attack windows for the Tarnished.

2 Leonine Misbegotten

Height: 7.5 Feet

Location

Castle Morne

Drops

3,800 Runes, Grafted Blade Greatsword

HP

2,198

If players explore the Lands Between in a certain order, they'll likely come across Castle Morne sooner rather than later. This castle isn't particularly big, nor does it take a long time to explore to completion; however, it holds a formidable boss that looks like a failed experiment from some modern lab.

Leonine Misbegotten seems to be a hybrid of a lion, a dragon, and some kind of massive bird. This boss has a relatively repetitive attack pattern, including lunges that are reminiscent of Dark Souls 3 's Ringed City DLC final boss, Slave Knight Gael . That said, Leonine Misbegotten is considerably weaker than Gael and also seems to be smaller, "only" standing at 7.5 feet.

1 Soldier Of Godrick

Height: 7.2 Feet

Location

Stranded Graveyard

Drops

400 Runes

HP

384 (When not modified)

The Soldier of Godrick is meant to be a tutorial fight for newcomers who've either never played Elden Ring before or have never even touched a FromSoftware title. This boss is meant to be easy to dodge, parry, counter, and ultimately defeat. That said, for some reason, the Soldier of Godrick has also become a popular meme NPC, and several players and coders have taken it upon themselves to modify his stats and make him the strongest boss in the game.

The modified version of the Soldier of Godrick (affectionately nicknamed as "Rick, Soldier of God") takes no damage from even the strongest characters at level 713. This mighty soldier stands at approximately 7.2 feet tall, making him the smallest boss in Elden Ring .

item.title: Sony Shutting Down Rewards Program
item.description:
Highlights

  • Sony Rewards program is ending on December 31, 2024.
  • Users have until December 31 to redeem any remaining points, with bonus points requests accepted until July 21.
  • Sony could be refocusing efforts on the PlayStation Stars loyalty program, currently offline since early June, causing frustration.

Sony has announced that its long-running Rewards program will come to an end on December 31, 2024. First introduced in 2017 via the branded Sony and PlayStation credit cards, the Sony Rewards system allowed members to rack up points for purchases from the company's online storefront, which could then be redeemed for game discounts, gift cards, ancillary items, and so on.

Much like reward schemes from other companies, Sony Rewards grants a point for approximately one unit of supported currency spent, such as one dollar equating to one point. Members also had the option to apply for a Sony-branded credit card that accrued points from other eligible transactions. Back in 2021, Sony made a major change to the Rewards program, wherein it only allowed Sony or PlayStation credit card holders to earn points from purchases. The move was met with some criticism, and now, Sony is doing away with Rewards entirely.

An updated FAQ page on the official Sony Rewards website confirms that the company will be winding down operations for the Rewards website and mobile application on December 31, 2024. Members of the program have until then to redeem any leftover points and access their accounts, after which they will expire. Additionally, users can also submit bonus points and purchase credit request forms through the Sony Rewards app, but this can only be done up until July 21. Due to their similarities in nature, some may conflate Sony Rewards with 2022's PlayStation Stars loyalty program, but the latter is separate and will remain active.

When Will Sony Rewards Come to an End?

  • December 31, 2024

However, PlayStation Stars has been having major issues for some time now, as the service has been down since the beginning of PlayStation's Days of Play promotional period in early June. Sony has acknowledged the situation and claims to be actively working on rectifying the problem, but over two weeks later, PlayStation Stars has yet to go online again. Users still can't acquire new points or collectibles, which has been irksome for those who made several PlayStation Store purchases during Days of Play. PlayStation's customer support has reportedly reassured users that their points won't be lost, but many are still skeptical.

The closure of Sony Rewards may be disappointing to some of its users, but considering the scheme hasn't seen much improvement in recent years, the company may have made the decision to focus entirely on PlayStation Stars as its de facto loyalty program instead. With the service being down for over half a month, however, pressure mounts upon Sony to get it back online and allow members to cash in on PlayStation Stars' June rewards.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Reveals Twitch Drops for Season 11
item.description:
Highlights

  • Earn free Overwatch 2 Nihon Hanzo Epic skin & Letter on the Wind Kiriko spray on Twitch until June 24 for season 11 launch.
  • Overwatch 2 Season 11 introduces new Battle Pass, map, hero balances, Transformers crossover, & Hanzo skin not available for purchase.
  • Link Battle.net & Twitch accounts and watch Overwatch 2 streamers to get free cosmetics until June 25, then again from June 25-30.

Overwatch 2 fans can get the Nihon Hanzo Epic skin and the Letter on the Wind Kiriko spray for free as Twitch drops right now. These cosmetics are being given away from now through June 24 to commemorate the start of Overwatch 2 Season 11.

Recently, Overwatch 2 began its 11th season. Called Super Mega Ultrawatch, Season 11 comes with a Power Rangers -esque Battle Pass refresh, the new Runasapi Push map, and a crossover with Transformers . As always, Overwatch 2 Season 11 also brought hero balance changes, including a nerf to Roadhog and the return of Cassidys Flashbang.

To celebrate this new season, Overwatch 2 is giving away some awesome cosmetics. Until midday on June 25, players can watch three hours of any Overwatch 2 streamer on Twitch to earn the Letter on the Wind spray for Kiriko, and the Nihon Hanzo Epic skin for watching for four more hours after that. This skin is not always available for purchase with Overwatch Coins, so fans wont want to miss out on this skin if they dont have it yet.

How to Get Overwatch 2 Season 11 Twitch Drops

  • Attach ones Battle.net and Twitch accounts, then watch any streamers in the Overwatch 2 category through June 25 at 1:58 PM EDT to earn the following rewards:
    • 3 Hours Letter on the Wind Kiriko spray
    • 7 Hours Nihon Hanzo Epic skin

Nihon Hanzo was originally added in Overwatch 1 during the 2021 Summer Games event. Players could earn the skin for free during the in-game event, though the skin was later made available for purchase for 1000 Overwatch Coins a $10 value in subsequent years and offers. Featuring a stunning red-and-white color scheme and an intricate ginkgo branch pattern embroidered into it, this Epic skin shows off Hanzos Japanese heritage in a simple-yet-elegant way. Meanwhile, the charming Letter on the Wind Kiriko spray is a brand-new cosmetic drawn by OW2 fan Angela Ziegler, so fans should be sure to tune in on Twitch to make sure they get it.

Players who miss out on this first wave of Twitch Drops will have a second chance immediately after this campaign ends. From June 25 through June 30, players can get both of these cosmetics if they missed them on the first run. Additionally, they can pick up an icon drawn by Dani "OWGrandma" Ellis, that features an extra cute version of Rose Gold Mercy a recolor of the popular Overwatch 2 skin that returned this season during this second Twitch drop campaign.

Not long after, the Summer Games return to Overwatch 2 on July 9. With both it and the Transformers collab starting on the same day, players should be sure to save their Overwatch Coins to pick up any of the other new and returning cosmetics they might want.
